014package org.jdbi.v3.postgres;
015
016import java.math.BigDecimal;
017import java.sql.Types;
018import java.time.Duration;
019
020import org.jdbi.v3.core.argument.AbstractArgumentFactory;
021import org.jdbi.v3.core.argument.Argument;
022import org.jdbi.v3.core.argument.ObjectArgument;
023import org.jdbi.v3.core.config.ConfigRegistry;
024import org.postgresql.util.PGInterval;
025
026/**
027 * Postgres version of argument factory for {@link Duration}.
028 *
029 * <p>
030 * For simplicity, this implementation makes the duration positive before proceeding. However, this can cause an
031 * {@link ArithmeticException} to be thrown. E.g., this can occur if your duration is -2^63 seconds.
032 *
033 * <p>
034 * Not all {@link Duration}s can be represented as intervals in Postgres.
035 * One incompatibility results from {@link Duration}s that are too large. This is due to (1) {@link Duration}s using
036 * a {@code long} internally, and {@link PGInterval}s using {@code int}s; and (2) the conversion of days to months or
037 * years being ambiguous.
038 * Another results from {@link Duration}s being too precise; they have nanosecond precision, whereas Postgres has only
039 * microsecond.
040 * An {@link IllegalArgumentException} will be thrown in these cases.
041 * The handling of the second is subject to revision in the future; for example, it would be reasonable to have a
042 * configurable truncation option.
043 */
044public class DurationArgumentFactory extends AbstractArgumentFactory<Duration> {
045
046    public DurationArgumentFactory() {
047        super(Types.OTHER);
048    }
049
050    @Override
051    public Argument build(Duration duration, ConfigRegistry config) {
052        Duration d = duration;
053        final boolean isNegative = d.isNegative();
054        if (isNegative) {
055            d = d.negated();
056        }
057        final long days = d.toDays();
058        if (days > Integer.MAX_VALUE) {
059            throw new IllegalArgumentException(
060                    String.format("duration %s too large to be represented unambiguously as postgres interval",
061                            d));
062        }
063        d = d.minusDays(days);
064        final int hours = (int) d.toHours();
065        d = d.minusHours(hours);
066        final int minutes = (int) d.toMinutes();
067        d = d.minusMinutes(minutes);
068        if (d.getNano() % 1000 != 0) {
069            throw new IllegalArgumentException(
070                    String.format("duration %s too precise to represented as postgres interval", d));
071        }
072        double seconds = BigDecimal.valueOf(d.getSeconds())
073                .add(BigDecimal.valueOf(d.getNano()).movePointLeft(9))
074                .doubleValue();
075        final PGInterval interval = new PGInterval(0, 0, (int) days, hours, minutes, seconds);
076        if (isNegative) {
077            interval.scale(-1);
078        }
079        return ObjectArgument.of(interval, Types.OTHER);
080    }
081}
